intro: Marsdenia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It produces clusters of small, white or pale green flowers, followed by follicles containing seeds. Marsdenia papuana is often found in moist, shaded environments and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
